summary: This document consists of email correspondence primarily between Shani Pinney, the Territorial Sex Offender Registry Program Manager for the Virgin Islands Department of Justice, and Darren Indyke, an attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein. The emails detail modifications to Epstein's travel plans, including his movements between various vacation homes in New York, Palm Beach, and Paris, as well as his expected return to the U.S. Virgin Islands. The correspondence highlights the ongoing communication regarding Epstein's travel as a registered sex offender.

persons.name: Shani Pinney
persons.role: Territorial Sex Offender Registry Program Manager
persons.context: Shani Pinney is responsible for managing the sex offender registry in the Virgin Islands and is the recipient of travel notifications regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is the attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein and is responsible for notifying Shani Pinney about Epstein's travel plans.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the subject of the travel notifications, detailing his movements as a registered sex offender.

connections.description: Darren Indyke communicates travel plans on behalf of his client, Jeffrey Epstein, to Shani Pinney.
Darren Indyke is the attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein in legal matters, including his registration as a sex offender.

events.title: Travel Notification
events.description: Darren Indyke notifies Shani Pinney of modifications to Jeffrey Epstein's travel plans.

events.title: Return to U.S. Virgin Islands
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein plans to return to his permanent residence in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's travel plans include multiple trips between his vacation homes in New York, Palm Beach, and Paris.
Darren Indyke is responsible for notifying the Virgin Islands Department of Justice about Epstein's travel as part of his obligations as a registered sex offender.
The correspondence indicates that Epstein's travel plans are subject to modification and require notification to the authorities.
